cite_01.original_display: McTernan v. City of York, 564 F.3d 636, 646 (3d. Cir. 2009) (citations omitted)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Third Circuit motion to dismiss case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Harrington v. City of Lancaster, 578 F.3d 412, 419 (3d Cir. 2010) (citations omitted)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Third Circuit civil rights case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Dietrich v. City of Reading, 571 F.3d 504, 510 (3d Cir. 2009) (citations omitted)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong pinpoint page (651 instead of 646)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: McTernan v. City of York, 564 F.3d 636, 651 (3d. Cir. 2009) (citations omitted)

wrong_citation.label: Transposed volume number (546 instead of 564)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: McTernan v. City of York, 546 F.3d 636, 646 (3d. Cir. 2009) (citations omitted)

mischaracterization.label: Exaggerated standard — includes conclusory allegations
mischaracterization.original_text: the court must accept all well-pleaded factual allegations as true
mischaracterization.replacement_text: the court must accept all factual allegations as true, including those that are merely conclusory in nature

misquotation.label: Changed 'any reasonable reading' to 'the most favorable reading'
misquotation.original_text: under any reasonable reading of the complaint, the plaintiff may be entitled to relief.
misquotation.replacement_text: under the most favorable reading of the complaint, the plaintiff may be entitled to relief.

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Supreme Court pleading standards case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Crawford v. Metropolitan Life Ins. Co., 553 U.S. 218 (2008)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong starting page (686 instead of 662)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Ashcroft v. Iqbal, 556 U.S. 686 (2009)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong volume (558 instead of 556)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Ashcroft v. Iqbal, 558 U.S. 662 (2009)

misquotation.label: Smoothed awkward phrasing in quote
misquotation.original_text: demands more than an unadorned, the defendant-unlawfully-harmed-me accusation
misquotation.replacement_text: demands more than an unadorned accusation that the defendant unlawfully harmed the plaintiff

cite_03.original_display: Bell Atlantic Corp. V. Twombly, 550 U.S. 544, 557 (2007)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Supreme Court pleading standards case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Riverbend Assocs. v. Slattery, 549 U.S. 312, 320 (2007)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong pinpoint page (555 instead of 557)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Bell Atlantic Corp. V. Twombly, 550 U.S. 544, 555 (2007)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong volume (552 instead of 550)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Bell Atlantic Corp. V. Twombly, 552 U.S. 544, 557 (2007)

mischaracterization.label: Dramatically overstated pleading standard
mischaracterization.original_text: ‘labels and conclusions’ or ‘a formulaic recitation of the elements of a cause of action will not do.’
mischaracterization.replacement_text: specific evidentiary facts demonstrating a reasonable likelihood of success are required to state a claim.

cite_04.case_name: Kiessling v. State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co.
cite_04.original_display: Kiessling v. State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co., 2019 US. Dist. LEXIS 24085, at *5-6 (E.D. Pa. 2019)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated E.D. Pa. insurance bad faith case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Patterson v. State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co., 2019 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 31742, at *5-6 (E.D. Pa. 2019)

wrong_citation.label: Transposed LEXIS digits (24805 instead of 24085)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Kiessling v. State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co., 2019 US. Dist. LEXIS 24805, at *5-6 (E.D. Pa. 2019)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong LEXIS year (2018 instead of 2019)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Kiessling v. State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co., 2018 US. Dist. LEXIS 24085, at *5-6 (E.D. Pa. 2019)

mischaracterization.label: Fabricated fourth step in three-part test
mischaracterization.original_text: Third, the District Court must identify the well-pleaded, non-conclusory factual allegations, and determine whether the complaint states a plausible claim for relief. Id.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: Third, the District Court must identify the well-pleaded, non-conclusory factual allegations, and determine whether the complaint states a plausible claim for relief. Id. Fourth, the court must also consider whether the plaintiff has identified specific individuals responsible for the bad faith conduct. Id.

mischaracterization.label: Wrong topic — real case about employment retaliation
mischaracterization.replacement_citation: Rivera v. State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co., 2019 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 27435 (E.D. Pa. 2019)

cite_05.original_display: Brown v. Progressive Insurance Company, 860 A. 2d 493 (Pa. Super. 2004)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Pa. Superior Court bad faith case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Delgado v. Nationwide Insurance Company, 865 A.2d 498 (Pa. Super. 2004)

wrong_citation.label: Transposed volume digits (680 instead of 860)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Brown v. Progressive Insurance Company, 680 A. 2d 493 (Pa. Super. 2004)

wrong_citation.label: Wrong starting page (439 instead of 493)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Brown v. Progressive Insurance Company, 860 A. 2d 439 (Pa. Super. 2004)

mischaracterization.label: Exaggerated holding — 'no matter how substantial'
mischaracterization.original_text: a mere dispute as to value, without more, does not amount to bad faith.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: any dispute as to the value of a claim, no matter how substantial the difference, cannot form the basis of a bad faith action.

cite_06.original_display: Johnson v. Progressive Ins. Co., 987 A. 2d 781 (Pa. Super. 2009)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Pa. Superior Court insurance case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Mitchell v. Geico Ins. Co., 991 A.2d 804 (Pa. Super. 2010)

wrong_citation.label: Transposed volume digits (978 instead of 987)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Johnson v. Progressive Ins. Co., 978 A. 2d 781 (Pa. Super. 2009)

mischaracterization.label: Fabricated 50% threshold for bad faith
mischaracterization.original_text: bad faith is not present merely because an insurer makes a low but reasonable estimate of an insured’s damages.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: an insurer’s offer of less than 50% of the claim’s established value creates a rebuttable presumption of bad faith.

misquotation.label: Synonym swap — 'routine disagreement' for 'normal dispute'
misquotation.original_text: nothing more than a normal dispute
misquotation.replacement_text: nothing more than a routine disagreement

mischaracterization.label: Fabricated requirements (dollar amount, named individual)
mischaracterization.original_text: The plaintiff’s conclusory statements argued only that defendant had “unreasonably withheld payment of underinsured motorist benefits under the policy, failed to make a reasonable offer of settlement, . . . [and] failed to perform an adequate investigation of the value of his claim.”
mischaracterization.replacement_text: The court dismissed the bad faith claim, noting that plaintiff had failed to allege a specific dollar amount of damages or identify the individual adjuster responsible for the denial. These were the very type of bare-bones allegations that the Court found insufficient for purposes of stating a viable, statutory bad faith claim.

cite_12.original_display: Kosmalski v. Progressive Preferred Ins., 2018 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 74124, at *1 (E.D. Pa. 2018)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated E.D. Pa. Progressive insurance case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Wojcik v. Progressive Preferred Ins., 2018 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 78231, at *1 (E.D. Pa. 2018)

wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Kosmalski v. Progressive Preferred Ins., 2018 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 74214, at *1 (E.D. Pa. 2018)

misquotation.label: Paraphrased instead of quoted
misquotation.original_text: the Court is unable to infer bad faith
misquotation.replacement_text: the Court cannot conclusively determine bad faith

mischaracterization.label: Fabricated 'industry guidelines' requirement
mischaracterization.original_text: Judge Pappert dismissed the bad faith claim, holding that plaintiff’s allegations were insufficient to “raise the claim to a level of plausibility required to survive a Rule 12(b)(6) motion to dismiss.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: Judge Pappert dismissed the bad faith claim, noting that the plaintiff had failed to allege that the insurer’s conduct deviated from established industry claims-handling guidelines.

mischaracterization.label: Overstated burden — 'disfavored' and 'substantial prejudice'
mischaracterization.original_text: A decision to grant or deny a motion to strike a pleading, or any part of it, is vested in the trial court’s discretion.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: Motions to strike are disfavored and should only be granted when the moving party demonstrates substantial prejudice.

cite_18.original_display: Lane v. McLean, 2018 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 54033 (M.D. Pa. 2018)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated M.D. Pa. motion to strike case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Porter v. Henderson, 2018 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 57219 (M.D. Pa. 2018)

wrong_citation.label: Transposed LEXIS digits (54303 instead of 54033)
wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Lane v. McLean, 2018 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 54303 (M.D. Pa. 2018)

mischaracterization.label: Lowered standard — 'not directly relevant' instead of 'no possible relation'
mischaracterization.original_text: The moving party must establish that the allegations have no possible relation to the controversy, may cause prejudice to one of the parties, or otherwise confuse the issues
mischaracterization.replacement_text: The moving party need only show that the challenged allegations are not directly relevant to the primary claims, may cause prejudice to one of the parties, or otherwise confuse the issues

cite_19.original_display: Hoffer v. Grange Ins. Co., 2014 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 71079 (M.D. Pa. 2014)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated E.D. Mich. habeas case
fabricated_case.replacement_citation: Reeves v. Stoddard, No. 2:14-CV-10977, 2019 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 27435, at *1 (E.D. Mich. Feb. 21, 2019)

mischaracterization.label: Subtly wrong definition of 'immaterial'
mischaracterization.original_text: Immaterial matter is that which has no essential or important relationship to the claim for relief.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: Immaterial matter is that which is unlikely to influence the outcome of the case.

cite_20.original_display: Stepanovich v. State Farm, No. 1239 WDA, 2013 No. 1296 WDA 2012 (Pa. Super. October 15, 2013)

fabricated_case.label: Fabricated Pa. Superior Court UIM case

wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Stepanovich v. State Farm, No. 1293 WDA, 2013 No. 1296 WDA 2012 (Pa. Super. October 15, 2013)

mischaracterization.label: Fabricated 'exhaustion of appeals' requirement
mischaracterization.original_text: the contract is not technically breached until there has been a determination of liability and an award of damages in excess of the tortfeasor’s liability limits.
mischaracterization.replacement_text: the contract is not technically breached until there has been a determination of liability, an award of damages, and exhaustion of all available appellate remedies.

misquotation.label: Added 'arbitration' concept not in original
misquotation.original_text: the contract is not technically breached until there has been a determination of liability and an award of damages in excess of the tortfeasor’s liability limits.
misquotation.replacement_text: the contract is not breached until damages have been conclusively established through litigation or arbitration.

wrong_citation.replacement_citation: Wagner v. State Farm Mut. Auto. Ins. Co., 2014 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 194455 (E.D. Pa. Feb. 20, 2014)

mischaracterization.label: Exaggerated holding — 'per se irrelevant' in 'all cases'
mischaracterization.original_text: information about claims handling is not relevant to a breach of contract claim
mischaracterization.replacement_text: in all UIM breach of contract cases, information about claims handling is per se irrelevant and may not be sought through any discovery mechanism

misquotation.label: Swapped 'relevant' for 'admissible' — legally distinct
misquotation.original_text: information about claims handling is not relevant to a breach of contract claim
misquotation.replacement_text: information about claims handling is generally not admissible in a breach of contract action
